fields.description:
When sharing relative links to one of my wiki pages, they often don't work. This is probably because the links i'm sharing are relative, are using the ToC macro, which has all sorts of problems, and my links (H2 headers) end with a question mark.

At the end of a line being used in a Table of Contents macro, a '?' is not handled properly.

So my question here:

https://jitterbit.atlassian.net/wiki/display/~peter.smith/FAQ#FAQ-HowdoIuseplugins?

Should actually have a URL like this:

https://jitterbit.atlassian.net/wiki/display/~peter.smith/FAQ#FAQ-HowdoIuseplugins%3F

or similar.

Because most clients will interpret the '?' as a query string, thus not link it. 

So the id, instead of looking like this:

<h2 id="FAQ-HowdoIuseplugins?">

should probably look something like this:

<h2 id="FAQ-HowdoIuseplugins%3F">

or whatever alternate encoding scheme you want to use. Wikimedia uses a ".3F" notation.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Table of Contents does not handle question marks properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If labels or new variables are added to Blueprint templates, pages created from this templates won't have these variables/labels.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
- Open one of Blueprint templates on edtition mode
- Add labels and new variables to the template
- Save the template
- Create a new page using the template you modified
-- The labels won't be added and the variables won't be shown

h3. Expected Results
Labels should be added and while creating the page the user shou;d have the option to fill the variable

h3. Actual Results
New variables and labels will be ignored by the pages created from template.

*If the new variables and labels are added on a template created by the users then labels/variabled will work as expected for new pages
h3. Workarounds
fields.summary: Labels and new variables don't work on Blueprint templates

fields.description:
Exported PDFs from Adobe Creative Cloud Applications are not being rendered correctly in the preview for Confluence pages .

They appear much lighter / colors are washed out than the actual document. 

Steps To Replicate:
1. Open up Adobe Illustrator CC 2014
2. Create document with colors
3. Save as PDF
4. Insert into Confluence page
5. Click image and image is not rendered correctly in preview

Recreated in {{Confluence 5.8-OD-51-008}}
Issue happening in Safari {{Version 8.0.6 (10600.6.3)}}, Firefox {{37.0.2}} & Chrome {{Version 42.0.2311.135 (64-bit)}}

{color:#d04437}*****Edit*********
{color}
Looks like other exported pdfs are not rendering correctly in Confluence preview as well. However not as drastically.
fields.summary: PDF's Exported From Adobe Creative Cloud Applications Are Not Being Rendered Correctly In Preview For Confluence Pages

fields.description:
Cannot create new at Confluence onDemand using REST API.
Steps to reproduce:
- generate new instance of Confluence onDemand without any additional products;
- using any tool execute REST request:
{code}
Authorization: Basic, with username/password
URL: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?expand=groups
Headers: Content-Type=application/json, Accept=application/json
Body:
{
"name":"testuser0002@mail.com",
"password":"Abcd1234",
"emailAddress":"testuser0002@mail.com",
"displayName":"Test User0002",
"notification":false
}
{code}

Expected result: 
- new user created

Actual result: 
- response with code 503 (Service Temporarily Unavailable)

Affected versions: 
- Confluence onDemand 5.9.1-OD-2015.39.1-0001

Workaround:
- add JIRA to existing instance of Confluence
fields.summary: Confluence REST API does not creates a user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While switching between formatting styles in Confluence while using Google Chrome, the cursor will disappear, causing the user not to be able to type until they click the screen again with their mouse.

Tested in Firefox and Safari, and do not have the same issue.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2016.01.1-0003
* Google Chrome Version 47.0.2526.106 (and now 49.*)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new Confluence page
# Select Heading 1, and type a header.
# Carriage return, and type a paragraph.
# Carriage return again, and switch to heading.

h3. Expected Results
The heading changes and the user can continue typing without having to click on the screen again.

h3. Actual Results
If you test this in Google Chrome, the cursor will disappear, and you will not be able to type.

[^Recording #4.mp4]

h3.Workaround
Use Firefox, Safari, or Internet Explorer instead, or re-click the screen after changing formatting.
fields.summary: Changing formatting in Chrome causes cursor to disappear

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JQL search autocomplete has stopped working in JIRA gadgets on confluence.  Exe: JIRA issue macro

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add JIRA issue macro to confluence page (Or any macro that uses a JIRA JQL filter)
# Start typing JQL filter

h3. Expected Results
Autocomplete Popup to display available options for filter result completion

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens:
!Screen Shot 2015-08-26 at 5.18.23 PM.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
- Configure valid filter in JIRA issue navigator to use autocomplete options
- Copy filter
- Past into gadget filter option field and save:
!Screen Shot 2015-08-26 at 4.37.16 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Additional Notes:
- The PIE chart gadget fails to accept filters currently and looks related to:
-- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44824
!Screen Shot 2015-08-26 at 4.35.47 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JQL Autocomplete Not working on JIRA Gadgets in Confluence

h3. Summary
Confluence iOS hides Title after using Reply after App Close

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* iOS 9.3.2
* Confluence iOS v1.3.15.11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse to a page
# Scroll down and tap "Reply" to any comment to bring up the Keyboard
# Click on Home button to go back to home
# Go back to Confluence iOS
# Tap to exit Keyboard
# Scroll back to top of screen and observe

h3. Expected Results

Confluence app should show the Page Title

h3. Actual Results
Confluence app hides the Page Title under navigation bar
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Click on the Back arrow on the top-left, then tap back into the page
fields.summary: Confluence iOS hides Title after using Reply after App Minimize

fields.description:
Detected after this week's release on Confluence Cloud, whenever a customer ran pdf export, the connection pool used is more than 10 connections which made it fairly easy to run into connection pool exhaustion and the instance is not available.

*Steps for replication*

Run a pdf export for a space, preferable a larger space as it shows the issue better.

*Expected Result*

The import shows in a page similar to indexing, where it indicates the progress. And manage the resources accordingly.

*Actual Result*

The page seems to be loading, until the timeout at 60 seconds, the page unavailable is shown. Then checking on the connections to db, noticed that approximately 13~16 connections is being used despite the instance has no activity.

*Workaround*

There is no workaround at this moment. Make sure that only one export is requested at a time, across the entire instance. If it reaches time-out, do not attempt export again.

*Solution*
* We still acquire semaphore
* Instead of acquiring indefinitely timeout set to 30 seconds (controller via system property)
fields.summary: PDF Export is using up Excessive Connections to DB

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If public access is disabled and permissions are specified for anonymous access authenticated users that shouldn't have access to the space will inherit permissions. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Specify permissions on a test space to administrators only.
# Do not enable pubic access but specify all permissions on anonymous access for the test space. 
# Access the space with a user account that isn't an administrator. 

!modified.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

Since anonymous access is disabled. Only administrators should be able to access the space. 

h3. Actual Results
Any authenticated confluence user  can access the space as well as they have the same permissions as specified on anonymous access. 


h3.Workaround
Remove all permissions for public access (which is the default). 
!default.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Authenticated users inherit  anonymous access space permissions with public access disabled.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Moving a page with _Page Tree Macro_ that has {{@self}} _Root Page_ to a new space will cause the _Page Tree Macro_ to stop working. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page 
# Add Page Tree Macro; Root Page {{@self}}
# Move the page to another space 

h3. Expected Results
The _Page Tree Macro_ should work on the new space 

h3. Actual Results
The _Page Tree Macro_ will not work on the new space with the below error. 
{{The root page DAT:@self could not be found in space Test by Atlassian.}}

!newspace.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Edit the _Page Tree Macro_ and remove the previous space details on the _Root Page_:

!self.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Page Tree Macro with @self Root Page will not work after page move

fields.description: In the Audit Log the event 'space removed' should be called 'space deleted' in line with the Delete Space feature.
fields.summary: Audit Log 'space removed' should be 'space deleted'

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
- Have a page on Confluence with some text formatted with strickthrough
- Select this specific text
- Add inline comment
- Click save

*Expected Results:*
Comment should be saved.

*Actual Results:*
The following alert shows up and the comment is not saved.

Alert:
{code}We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.{code}

*Notes:*
All other formatting type work as expected but this one.
fields.summary: Inline-comments does not work for strikethrough text

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Chrome or Internet Explorer, users cannot copy tables, using the shortcut keys that are mentioned in the following documentation: 
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf57/working-with-tables-701434777.html
This funcitonality works in Firefox and Safari. 

h3. Environment
* Chrome 51.0.2704.103
* Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence
# Add a 2x2 table without a header
# Highlight the table 
# Click Ctrl +C or Ctrl+Shift+C (or right click to copy)
# Click Ctrl + V or Ctrl + Shift +V (or right click to paste)

h3. Expected Results
The full table should be copied.

h3. Actual Results
Only one row or column is copied.
 
h3.Workaround
Use Safari or Firefox.
fields.summary: Cannot copy/paste tables in Chrome or IE 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using JIRA Issues Macro in Confluence to display an issue with a JIRA Capture testing session, *Test Session(s)* column (from display options) displays only test session ID, and no link to the test session.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.5
* Confluence 5.8
* JIRA Capture - 2.9.0.29

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Create a test session|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CAPTURE/Working+with+Sessions] using Capture, and link it to a JIRA issue.
# In Confluence, [add JIRA Issues Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Conf/JIRA+Issues+Macro] to a page, and use it to display the JIRA issue you linked the test session to. In Display Options, ensure to select *Test Session(s)* as a column to display.

h3. Expected Results
- Test Session(s) column should be filled with a link to the test session, using the name of the test session.
- When you use JIRA search, and display the Test Session(s) column, it does display this.

h3. Actual Results
- Confluence displays an ID number, followed by a comma that seems a bit misplaced (e.g. 12345,)
- The Test Session(s) column appears normally in JIRA, so we know this is different only for Confluence.
- *Test Session(s)* appears as *Test Session(S)* in Confluence, which is minor, but shows that it might be getting data from a non-shared source.

h5. How it displays in Confluence:
!Screen Shot 2015-05-22 at 10.53.05.jpg|thumbnail!

h5. How it displays in JIRA:
!Screen_Shot_2015-05-22_at_10_52_54.jpg|thumbnail!

Apologies for the amount I've hidden, but you can see JIRA has an actual name for the test, and Confluence just shows an ID number and a comma.
 
h3.Workaround
Either use [Filter Results Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Filter+Results+Gadget] in JIRA dashboard instead, or manually link the test sessions in Confluence.
fields.summary: When using JIRA Issues Gadget in Confluence, Capture test sessions show only as numeric ID

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When selecting the *Other Macros* window in Confluence, JIRA related macros may show in another language other than the default.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence with a linked JIRA instance
 * Default language is the same on both JIRA and Confluence, but a few users have another language set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Clean instance with JIRA/Confluence with both default languages set to English (UK) or English (US)
 # Create 2 users, one with English as default language, and another with a secondary language.
 # While logged in as English user, attempt to insert macro using the insert menu, but select *Other Macros* and view JIRA macros. Ensure the language matches the current default, but it may match the default of the secondary language user(s)
 # Steps to replicate summarized from -JRA-28392-

h3. Expected Results

Macro menu language should match that of the default language.
h3. Actual Results

Language used to describe the JIRA macros in the *Select Macro* window matches secondary language.
h3. Notes

Possibly related to -JRA-28392- and -JRA-37916-
h3. Solution / Workaround
 * Restart JIRA, or in JIRA Administration "Refresh Client Resources" (System> User Interface > Look and Feel) and make sure that the language of the first user to browse the JIRA dashboard gadgets is the same as the system's default language.
fields.summary: Select Macro menu displays JIRA gadget summaries in another language

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a page hierarchy at least 4 levels deep.
2. Create a page at the root of the space called "sidebar" and add a page tree macro.  Set the depth of the page tree macro to 2.
3. Go to Space Tools > Look and Feel > Sidebar, Header and Footer and add the following wikimarkup
{code}{include:sidebar}{code}
4. Navigate to the deepest page in the page hierarcy (by URL, not by expanding the page tree in the sidebar)

Expected result: The page tree is expanded and the current page highlighted

Actual result: the page tree is not expanded, and the current page not highlighted

fields.description:
It's possible to have pages with enough attachments, that copying or editing them takes longer than 60 seconds and so runs into the Nginx timeout period in Cloud. This makes it hard for customers to understand why the page copy or editing is failing, and impossible to easily copy or edit a page with a lot of attachments

 

Workaround:

The customers can view the Source of the page and copy/paste the content to the new page:

# Open the page
# Navigate to *Page Operations* (***)
# Select *View Source*
# Select and copy all
# Open a new page and paste the content there
fields.summary: Pages copy or Page operations with large numbers of attachments should be run in the background with a "Long running task" view to avoid page timeout in Cloud

The Javascript console will repeatedly throw this error:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of null(anonymous function) @ batch.js?highlightactions=true&flavour=VANILLA&analytics-enabled=true&isAdmin=true&locale=en-GB&use…:5807

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After editing a page, when you have a link to an undefined page in Confluence, if you edit the page without changing the link, the link shows as changed in format, though it was not.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence
# Add this content to the page:
{panel}
First line
Link to non-existing page
Second line


Last line
{panel}
# Edit 'Link to non-existing page' to link to an undefined page:
#* Start a bracket '[' add the 'Link to non-existing page' after it and close it, saving as a link
#* Make sure no page with title 'Link to non-existing page' exists, as this is not being replicated in existing pages.
# Save the page
# Edit it again (it's importing to edit/save/edit as explained)
# Remove the last new line before 'Last line'
# Save the page
# In 'Page History' compare the last and the second to last versions

h3. Expected Results
The only change shown is the removed new line.

h3. Actual Results
The link to the undefined page is highlighted blue, though no formatting was changed.
 
h3. Notes
There are 2 very similar bugs for 'anchors':
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34243
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31206

However, I was unable to replicate this problem using anchor links and these bugs are not new. Maybe they were fixed.

h3.Workaround
None so far
fields.summary: Links to undefined pages are shown as changed in format though they're not

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to copy a page the *save* page option does nothing.  Occuring because of duplicate attachment reference values in the database.

h3. Environment
Discovered in Confluence CLOUD version 5.9.0-OD-58-008 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Copy a page
- Save copy

h3. Expected Results
Copy is saved

h3. Actual Results
save option has no response
The below exception is thrown in the jira log file:
{code}
src=spacemenfindSingleObject Uh oh - found more than one object when single object requested
{code} 
AND With Debugging enabled on the {{com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable}} (Administration Cog > General Configuration > Logging and Profiling), the following also appears for every occurrence of a duplicate:
{code}
2015-07-09 09:19:45.156582500 2015-07-09 09:19:45,155 DEBUG [conversion-thread-cloud-23-internal] [impl.runnable.cloud.CloudConversionRunnable] debug Ticket: /ticket/b4fa24e8-b663-471c-9692-9c0c0548d981
2015-07-09 09:19:45.164253500 2015-07-09 09:19:45,162 ERROR [conversion-thread-cloud-23] [plugins.conversion.impl.TimeoutConversionRunnable] run Cannot convert. Execution error: 
2015-07-09 09:19:45.164256500  -- referer: https://<BASEURL>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/editpage.action?pageId=<THE PAGE ID>
{code}

h3. Notes
To Identify the erring Files requires database access, so Cloud Users must file a support request at https://support.atlassian.com, Please reference this bug and the erring page in your request if this bug suspected.

Query to locate erring file attachments:
{code}
confluence=> Select title,count(1) from content where pageid = '<INSERT_PAGE_ID_HERE>' group by title having count(1) > 1;
{code}

h3.Workaround
Use the list generated from the Query above to locate the attachments:
- Download the erring attachments
- Delete the attachments as described here:
-- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Managing+Files#ManagingFiles-Deleteanattachedfile
- Re-upload the attachments to the page
fields.summary: Uh oh - found more than one object when single object requested

In Confluence Cloud, pages do not correctly render roadmap planner macro content, as neither the macro nor the pages scroll horizontally.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We want use the Info, Note, and Warning icons to add visual contrast in our documentation. The color and border of the macros show up when you export to PDF, but the icons are missing. This makes the notes look weird.

We haven’t figured out a good way to control page breaks. If we have a list of instructions and an associated screenshot, we’d want to break the page so that the instructions and screenshot appear together, or so that the doc is spaced out so that it’s obvious that there’s more content to come. When we export to PDF, sometimes we have widows and orphans and/or content that’s separated from the relevant screenshot. The large white spaces can be confusing to a reader. White space is inevitable because our docs contain large screenshots, but it would be great to be able to control where the white space occurs

h3. Steps to Reproduce
When you insert a small image in-line (such as an icon contained by parentheses), upon export to PDF the lines break around the image. So you’d have something like this:
Click the “trash” icon (
[icon image here]
) to delete the file.

h3. Expected Results

PDF exports exactly as we can see on the page

h3. Actual Results
 
PDF shows spaces and line breaks that are not available on the original page.

h3. Notes

Cloud version: 7.2.0-OD-01-031

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Macro icons don’t show up upon export to PDF

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the username is changed after creating the personal space, then if the personal space is favorited, the link displayed in the *My Spaces* list will lead to a page not found because this link leads to the old user profile page.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.177.1


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a personal space for *userA*
# Change username from *userA* to anything else (let's say *userB*).
# Favorite the personal space of *userA*
# Click on the link displayed on the *My Spaces* list in the sidebar.

h3. Expected Results
Link leads to the user profile (and even then should lead to user personal space).

h3. Actual Results
Leads to a _Page not Found_ as the link still refers to the old username (and the profile page does not exist anymore for this user)
 
h3. Notes
When favoriting a personal space, it should be better if it lead to the actual personal space and not the user profile.

h3.Workaround
Access personal space via the *Space directory*
fields.summary: If the username was changed, link to the personal space from My Spaces leads to Page not found

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If we have collaborative editing enabled and we edit a page with 'Page Properties' or 'Highlight' macro (and maybe even other macros), close draft and discard all changes, when re-editing it, new lines are added before and after the macro. This is also happening with tables, so a Page Properties macro with a table within (very common) will have lines added to both.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable 'Collaborative Editing' 
# Create a new page
# Add a Page Properties macro or table
#* Don't add any other text as, in some cases, it prevents this from happening
# Save it
# Edit it
#* In this first edit operation, you may already see extra new lines
# Make any change
# Close it and click 'Discard all changes' (we cannot reproduce it if draft is kept)
# Edit it again

h3. Expected Results
Since all changes were discarded, the second time the page is edited it looks the same.

h3. Actual Results
New lines are added. We can see by moving the cursor.
 
h3. Notes
This is not happening if Collaborative Editing is disabled.

h3.Workaround
Delete the lines and save.
fields.summary: Collaborative editing is adding new lines to Page Properties/Highlight macro or table when changes are discarded

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Livesearch macro of Confluence restricted by 2 or more labels and Space, if you hit enter after typing your words or click on *See more results for:* you get different results.
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-19 at 6.37.24 PM.png|thumbnail! 

When you hit enter, the macro will get as results only pages where the 2 or more labels are matched, although when you are typing the words on the Livesearch bar, the results suggested are not the ones you get when hit enter.

Analysing the URL you will be able to see that when you hit enter the macro validates if all 2 or more labels are available on one page, although the preview of the results displays pages where just 1 of the labels are on the page, no need for all labels be matched. Although if you click on "See more results for:" when you are typing your search, the macro shows exactly the results that are expected as shown in the preview.

URL when hitting enter:
{code}https://pece.atlassian.net/wiki/dosearchsite.action?cql=siteSearch+~+%22custom%22+and+space+%3D+%22TEST1%22+and+label+%3D+%22test%22+and+label+%3D+%22report%22+and+label+%3D+%22label%22&queryString=custom{code}

It's almost like two different searches. When changing the URL, replacing all the "and" for "or", it worked.

h3. Environment
Cloud
Confluence 1000.241.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Livesearch to a page
# Restrict it to the space you are working
# Restrict it using 3 labels
# Create 1 page with the first label and the word "test"
# Create 1 page with the second label and the word "test"
# Create 1 page with the third label and the word "test"
# Create 1 page with all labels and the word "test"
# Try to search on the live search for test
# Hit enter on the keyboard
# Click on the search button to display the URL
# Return to the livesearch page, to the same search and click on "See more results for:"

h3. Expected Results
In both cases, the macro should have the same behaviour, search for all labels, or separately.

h3. Actual Results
Shows nothing when hitting enter 

h3.Workaround
Click on "See more results for:"
fields.summary: Livesearch macro issues on search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Attachments Preview in Confluence Previews doesn't appear to display images in any specific order.

I've added images to the page either using a gallery macro, or only inserting the page. The first time you click an image, they are in order, but if you go through again, they will be shown in a random order.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud (currently 6.0.0-OD-2015.48.1-0006)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Confluence page and upload the test images.
# Two options here: Add *gallery* macro, and sort by name, *OR* simply embed images in a page making sure they are sorted in numeric order.
# Save the page
# Click on #1, and you are presented with the Attachment Preview. Click Next, and you'll see that the numbers are in order.
# Close the attachment preview. Click 1 again, and Next. You will see the numbers are out of order. If you choose the gallery option, they start counting backwards instead of forwards. If you choose to embed the images in the page without gallery macro, you will see they are presented out of order.
# Refresh the page, try the same again. You'll see the first try they are in order. 2nd tries they are random or backwards.

!Screen Shot 2015-11-26 at 16.51.09.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
I would expect the preview to either post the images in order every time, or by some other logic. It's only logical on the first try, but not subsequent ones.

h3. Actual Results
The images are loaded in a different order after the 1st attempt through.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page whenever you need to go through the gallery again.
fields.summary: Using Attachment Preview as a slideshow produces results out of order.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It's not possible to add a group which name contains a comma to the space permissions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group which name contains a comma
 # Go to a Confluence space and edit its permissions
 # Type the name of the group which contains a comma on its name
 # When the auto-complete returns it, click on it to select it
 # Click the _Add_ button

h3. Expected Results

The group is added to the list of groups with permissions on this space
h3. Actual Results

Two error messages are displayed saying no groups were found
h3. Notes

* Confluence "believes" there are at least 2 groups trying to be added and each group is separated by commas, when in fact there is only one group trying to be added, only this groups has a comma in its name.

* Also happens to groups with a space after its name: "Example "

h3. Workaround

Add a counter-slash (escape character) before the comma.
 Or change the group name and remove the comma.
fields.summary: Error when adding group with comma to space permissions

fields.description:
When a new blog post is created, adjusting the Posting Date does not change the blog post's date.

1. Click Create...Blog Post
2. Type or select a past date in the Posting Date field
3. Save post

Expected: Blog date should reflect the date entered in the Posting Date field

What happens: Blog date is always set to the current date.
fields.summary: Blog Posting Date is not applied when creating new blog posts

fields.description:
If a comment contains a single quote (') (or a double quote), it breaks syntax highlighting the next time a string is used - please see attached screenshot.

I'm not sure if this issue is unique to JavaScript syntax highlighting or if it affects other languages as well, but it certainly seems to affect all the different themes available for the macro.
fields.summary: Code Block Macro: JavaScript syntax highlighting incorrect if a comment contains '

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When selecting “Export to Word” on a page with a link to a JIRA issue from a Server instance with an application link, the process will fail and throw a 500 error. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud instance with an application link to a JIRA Server instance. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In a Confluence Cloud instance with an application link to a JIRA instance:
# Create a new page
# Insert a link to a JIRA issue from your JIRA instance
# Click save
# In the {{…}} menu dropdown, select *Export to Word*

h3. Expected Results
The Word file downloads to the browser. 

h3. Actual Results
Depending on your browser, you will see different results: 
In Chrome you will see message that says the URL could not be reached.
In Firefox, you will see "This site can’t be reached"
The below exception is thrown in the Confluence log file:
{noformat}
ERROR [http-bio-2010-exec-44] [[Catalina].[localhost].[/wiki].[exportword]] log Servlet.service() for servlet [exportword] in context with path [/wiki] threw exception
2016-04-06 09:37:28.570520500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2016-04-06 09:37:28.570520500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.http.Controller.handleNotFoundRedirectAndNotModified(Controller.java:269)
2016-04-06 09:37:28.570521500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.http.Controller.serveResource(Controller.java:218)
2016-04-06 09:37:28.570536500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.http.Controller.serveResource(Controller.java:61)
2016-04-06 09:37:28.570536500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.http.Router$2.apply(Router.java:49)
2016-04-06 09:37:28.570537500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.http.Router$2.apply(Router.java:46)
2016-04-06 09:37:28.570537500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.support.http.BaseRouter.callHandler(BaseRouter.java:193)
2016-04-06 09:37:28.570546500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.support.http.BaseRouter.dispatch(BaseRouter.java:163)
2016-04-06 09:37:28.570546500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.PluginResourceLocatorImpl.getDownloadableResource(PluginResourceLocatorImpl.java:214)
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Remove the link to the JIRA issue and try the export again.
fields.summary: Export to Word fails if there is a JIRA issue link from an instance with application links

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Log into a Confluence 5.9.1-OD-2015-39 instance on an iPhone running iOS9.
# Tap the navigation icon at the very top left (the hamburger menu).
# Tap any of the items ("Dashboard", "Recently Viewed", etc.).

h3. Expected results
Whichever menu item you selected loads.

h3. Actual results
Absolutely nothing happens when any of the links in the menu are selected.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to Access Pages In Confluence.

Only affects some instances.

h3. Environment
- Confluence 1000.85.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to Access Pages in Confluence

h3. Expected Results
Page loads without error

h3. Actual Results

Stack Trace is generated and displays the following message on screen:
{noformat}Cause

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you create a blog post in Confluence and set a backdated or old date as the Posting Date then hit publish the blog is still posted under today's date according to the blog location.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new blog post
# Enter an 2015-01-01 as the Posting Date in the bottom left corner
# Hit publish

h3. Expected Results

The blog should appear under the location 2015 / January / 01

h3. Actual Results

The blog is actually posted under today's date (in my case 2016 / January / 02)

h3.Workaround

No known workaround.
fields.summary: When creating a blog post with a backdated 'Posting Date' the post is incorrectly set as today

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Add a child page with a Page Properties macro on it.

In the Javascript console, {{/rest/masterdetail/1.0/detailssummary/lines?pageSize=30&pageIndex=0&cql=label+%3D+%22page-properties%22+and+space+%3D+currentSpace()&spaceKey=KEY&countComments=false&countLikes=false&sortBy=&reverseSort=}} is returning a 401:

}

{code}

fields.description:
Cannot create new user at Confluence onDemand using SOAP API.
Steps to reproduce:
- generate new instance of Confluence onDemand only (checked at trial version without integrated JIRA and other products).
- Using any tool execute SOAP request addUser with equal name & email fields.

Expected result:
New user appears
Actual result:
HibernateSystemException

Affected Confluence onDemand version: 5.9.1-OD-2015.39.1-0001

Request:
- URL: https://oktaconfluenceonly.atlassian.net/wiki/rpc/soap-axis/confluenceservice-v1
- Body:
{code}
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:soap="http://soap.rpc.confluence.atlassian.com">
   <soapenv:Header/>
   <soapenv:Body>
      <soap:addUser soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/">
         <in0 xsi:type="xsd:string">a4519791be</in0>
         <in1 xsi:type="bean:RemoteUser" xmlns:bean="http://beans.soap.rpc.confluence.atlassian.com">
            <email xsi:type="xsd:string">someuser12345@mail.ru</email>
            <fullname xsi:type="xsd:string">OKTA TestUser0001</fullname>
            <name xsi:type="xsd:string">someuser12345@mail.ru</name>
            <url xsi:type="xsd:string"></url>
         </in1>
         <in2 xsi:type="xsd:string">Abcd1234</in2>
      </soap:addUser>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>
{code}
 
Error response - see attached file [^HibernateExceptionResponse.txt]
fields.summary: Confluence SOAP API throws HibernateSystemException while creating new user

full log attached: [^sync_error.txt]
 
h3. Notes
* System Administrator and the default administrator have access to Confluence but no other user does.
* It only affects new Cloud sites 
* It may last from 1 to 4 hours until it is automatically fixed 
* Once the initial sync is done, this problem doesn't happen again on the same site.

h3. Cause
User Directory hasn't synced correctly with Confluence yet so no other user group memberships are passed from the User Management database to the Confluence Database.

h3.Workaround
# Flush all caches in Confluence
# Manually sync Confluence directory from /wiki/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/list
# Access the user's profile page: https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/display/~username

Some of these operations are restricted to sysadmin users only. Please log a request at https://support.atlassian.com
The sync may require several attempts until is synced.
fields.summary: "Not Permitted" shows for all Users in new Confluence Cloud site

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After publishing a blog with _Posting date_ older than current day Confluence displays it in current's month folder on the left menu.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create Blog Post
# Insert a title and select a Posting Date from last month, for example.
# This post will be displayed on this month's folder on the left menu.

h3. Expected behaviour
* Confluence should list the post in the left menu according to the Posting Date.

h3. Workaround
* There's no current workaround for it.
fields.summary: Blog posts date is not correct

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to install an Atlassian Cloud plugin the following error is thrown:

{quote}
This add-on cannot be installed without the Atlassian Connect framework. See our documentation for more information.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to install the Google Maps plugin from https://<instance-url>.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/search?q=google%20maps%20for%20confluence

h3. Expected Results

Plugin is installed

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown:
{noformat}
This add-on cannot be installed without the Atlassian Connect framework. See our documentation for more information.
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

Go to 'Manage add-ons' at https://<instance-url>.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm and enable the Atlassian Connect plugin then try installing the plugin again.
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud throws 'This add-on cannot be installed without the Atlassian Connect framework.' when installing connect add-on

fields.description:
When placing formatted content within a span, the formatting is stripped out and inconsistent between the edit, preview, and final display.

For example, the Table of Contents Macro will appear correctly formatted in the preview, but totally absent from the final published form. Table styling and formatting is (mostly) stripped out of the preview and final published form. Interestingly, Bold and Italics formatting are preserved.

I've attached screenshots of each of the three views. I've reproduced this on two separate cloud installations of confluence. It has not always been this way, but I do not know precisely when this bug was introduced.

*Reproduction:*
# Create a new confluence page
# Populate the page with content 
# Insert a span macro (optional: provide css)
# Insert any formatted content within the span
# Preview the page, note whether or not the formatting is preserved
# Save the page, note whether or not the formatting is preserved
fields.summary: Formatting and Display Issues within Spans

fields.description:
Confluence Cloud is currently capable of connecting with HipChat. However, when creating the link, Confluence only allows you to be redirected to 'www.hipchat.com',

This allows you to link it with Atlassian HipChat, but not with a HipChat Server. 

If you click here:
!hc_integration.png|thumbnail!

You're redirected to:
!hc_site.png|thumbnail!

The [documentation for integration HC Server with other applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/HC/Integrations+with+HipChat+Server] links to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Using+HipChat+and+Confluence+together], which states that the connection can be done in that page, even though we can't.

This was actually fixed as an HC issue, but it seems that it was not applied to Cloud.

JIRA gives a separate option for HC server integration:
!hc_jira.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Can't connect HipChat Server with Confluence.

fields.description:
*Summary*
Markdown preview does not working display the result properly

Steps to reproduce:
# Edit/create any Confluence page.
# Click *Insert* -> *Markup*
# Paste the following script:
{noformat}
| Day     | Meal    | Price |
| --------|---------|-------|
| Monday  | pasta   | $6    |
| Tuesday | chicken | $8    |
{noformat}
From this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Markdown+syntax+guide], the script should be able to display properly in Markdown preview.

*The Current Result*
The preview shows like the below image:
!Selection_112.png|thumbnail!

*The Expected Result*
It should show the table display like the below result:
!Selection_113.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Markdown preview does not display the result properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The issue happens when creating a link to the anchor in a page. This is related to the this [bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-39958].

h5. Environment:
- Google Chrome Version 46.0.2490.86 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Documentation Theme
# Create an Achor
# Create a link to the anchor
# Click the link to the anchor

h3. Expected Results
It should navigate to the expected link.

h3. Actual Results
The links do not work.

h3. Notes
Nothing is thrown in the logs or the browser console.
Only affects Documentation Theme. Global Look and Feel doesn't have this problem.

h3.Workaround
After you click on the anchored link, the URL in the browser will update but nothing will happen. Click on the URL in the browser navigator and click Enter. That will take you to the desired page.

OR

Windows - Right Click, or MAC Control+Click, on the link and select open in new tab

OR

Update theme to Global Look and Feel
fields.summary: Link Created to the anchors don't work

h3. Summary
Site Import isn't working.

For security reason, only these class types are allowed in clustered job parameters: [java.lang.String, boolean, char, byte, double, float, int, long, short, java.lang.Boolean, java.lang.Character, java.lang.Number, java.lang.Byte, java.lang.Double, java.lang.Float, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Long, java.lang.Short]{code}

Import finishes succesfully

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When collaboratively editing a document with another user, you receive a warning:
 !Screen Shot 2016-03-19 at 15.35.13.jpg|thumbnail! 

{quote}This page is also being edited by John Smith. Your changes will be merged with theirs when you save.{quote}

If you close this warning, in about 23-30 seconds, another warning appears, and so forth.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2016.11.1-1091

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a document to edit in Confluence.
# Open a window in Incognito Mode or Private browsing. Login as another Confluence user. Edit the same document.

h3. Expected Results
# Warning appears and is dismissed.
# Warning does not return.

h3. Actual Results
# Warning appears and is dismissed.
# Warning repeatedly returns every 23-30 seconds, disrupting workflow.

h3.Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: As a user, unable to permanently dismiss concurrent editors warning

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On Cloud, Confluence previewing does not render .PPT files correctly. Here under are the formatting issues encountered:
* Text boxes display on two lines in Confluence but show as a single line in ppt.
* Any shapes, images, text with drop shadows will have the shadow displaced by several inches from the original image.
* Lines that join one shape or image to another often don't render as they're seen in PPT, so they may not join up neatly.
* Images, text boxes etc that have a reasonable margin from page edges in PPT can look very close to the edge when rendered in Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a .PPT file to a Confluence page.
# Preview the .PPT file

h3. Expected Results
PPT file is rendered correctly and the result is the same as if the file was open in PowerPoint.

h3. Actual Results
PPT file is not rendered correctly with original formatting not kept.
fields.summary: PPT files are not rendered correctly in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
Hi,

* The max limit of 20 labels is still around.
* Related issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24552 

* According to CONF-24552 this issue was resolved in Confluence 4.
* In the version I'm using, the issue (still) exists.

Script:
# 1. In the label window, I've typed all letters of the alphabet (all seperated by spaces)
# 2. I click the button Add
# 3. I get the message that I cannot add more than 20 labels at once. All labels are gone and I am not able to recover them

The easy workaround o/c: click the add button before you enter 20 labels.

Regards,

P
fields.summary: Limit on labels: max 20 labels - issue not resolved or back

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Exporting Confluence Pages containing a Roadmap Planner Macro are slow to complete

h3. Environment
5.9.0-OD-55

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add the Roadmap Planner Macro and using the Example data provided
# Export to PDF using Content Tools Export
#- It cannot be exported using *Tools* > *Export to PDF* due to it taking more than 60 seconds to complete. 

h3. Expected Results
Per the Workaround in CONF-19815 to utilize the Space Tools Export to PDF of larger pages, the page should export to PDF within a few minutes like other pages

h3. Actual Results
Just using the example data on the Roadmap Planner Macro, it takes ~10-15 minutes for the Export to PDF to complete.
If there is more data, it will take much longer; for instance, a Roadmap Planner Macro consisting of 4 Lanes and 30 Bars takes 60-90 Minutes to Export to PDF 

Due to the length of time it takes to export, a user may experience a session disconnect while they wait for the export and would not be able to collect the file
 
h3. Notes
Exporting to HTML of the same page takes only a few minutes
fields.summary: Export to PDF of Pages Containing Roadmap Planner Macro Slow to Complete
